Description.en: All players must immediately play a Stance card.
All players holding at least one Betrayal must raise their hands. You may swap any held Stance of yours for a Betrayal of their choice.
All players must immediately reveal their Cacophony cards. If there are 3 or fewer other Cacophony cards revealed, gain that many points. Otherwise, discard all your Action cards.
All other players discard two Action cards. If Joy is in play, double this effect.
You may play two Action cards immediately. If Misery has been played this round, you may play three Action cards immediately instead.
Cancel the effects of another player's Action.

Instant.en: At any point while a player is playing an Action.

Description.en: You have 60 seconds to look at the Action card deck. You may order it or shuffle it in any way you wish before putting it back.
All players holding at least one Bargain must raise their hands. You may swap any held Stance of yours with a Bargain of their choice.
You may swap two of your played Stance cards.
Choose a player to reveal their held Stance cards, then give them this Burning Truth card.
If a player tries to take or swap any of your held cards, reveal this card and negate that effect. The player must also discard all their Action cards.
All other players must discard two Actions.
You may look at the played Stance cards of any one other player.
While this card is in effect, no Action cards may be drawn.
Remove Famine from play. Draw as many Action cards as there are players, then give each player one card of your choosing.
Remove all Persistent cards from play.
You may turn any of your own played Stances face-up.
While you hold this card, you may not play any other Actions.
If another player has Love, they may reveal it and discard it, and you both gain 2 points. Only the first player to reveal will gain points. If no player reveals Love, you lose 2 points.
All players must give you one of their Action cards, of their choosing.
All players, including yourself, must reveal one of their played Stances and then return it to their hand.
If an Action allows a player to take cards from your hand, you may pick it up and play it yourself immediately afterwards.
